domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text:
Imagine if you came across a dead body, and the police told you they've looked at the photos you provided, but couldn't be bothered to investigate as the body is too decayed.

That's pretty much what the Environment Agency has told me about a huge spill I found on Google Maps.

It's Monday, must be time for another @EnvAgency failure.

"Farmers on average receive a pollution inspection from the Environment Agency every 263 years.

https://t.co/VMQ2CkIp4M

https://t.co/acZHfaMlT2 https://t.co/ZlawffoTiE

tweets.text:
On Friday we submitted a response to an Environment Agency consultation on discharging water from the HS2 tunnel construction compound into the River Colne. Find out more here, in this post from the River Chess Association @ColneCAN
https://t.co/o8LR8u44VB

We are still in attendance at a large fire in Avonmouth. The smoke from the incident is affecting a large area. Advice is to close all windows and doors and stay inside where possible. @PHE_uk @BristolCouncil @EnvAgencySW @bristolportpol @ASPolice #teamwork

tweets.text:
High w/end rainfall meant we had to operate Twerton sluice gates to control high flows in Avon.

Both gates were operated successfully using manual controls.

Today we raised the vertical gate slightly to remove trapped debris This went smoothly & the debris successfully removed. https://t.co/H5w3C0wt8u

@IFMFish @EnvAgency @CefasGovUK @The_MMO Technology is available to prevent entrainment of fish into intakes - reference the Thames Water Eel screens on the London reservoir intakes in the middle Thames region. Other designs must be available ?

urls.title: Help Callum 360 - A child's-eye VR view of floods and disaster recovery
urls.description: Help Callum 360 video tells the true story of a young boy whose house was flooded, using his own words and seeing through his own eyes. This 360 project is a...

tweets.text:
Check out this awesome new flood awareness digital engagement tool produced by Lancaster University, the University of Hull and the EA. This 360 video uses virtual scenes to give you a child‚Äôs-eye view of flooding.
https://t.co/fB5FPGdH33
#floodriskawareness
The Warwickshire field team have been busy clearing debris screens around Warwickshire to keep our rivers clear and ready for the rain to come. https://t.co/IyzwSMsohj

@RussellB1ggs @TheLynnNews @Feargal_Sharkey @jamesowild @AngliaEnforceEA @WNGreens @N_Rivers_Trust @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd The EA check a farm out on average every 263 years for contamination run off into streams and rivers ! Ie amount of farms divided by amount of farm visits.

#Fish of the Severn Estuary are under threat. Thousands of fish will die in the double-decker sized cooling tunnels at Hinkley Point C. @EnvAgency @CefasGovUK @The_MMO please make the right decision and make sure an AFD is installed, as the DCO states. #SaveSevernsFish

This weekends rain has put the newly installed leaky woody dams at Charlton to the test & proven very effective at holding back the flood waters #nfm #naturalfloodmanagement #worcestershire #slowtheflow @worcscc @EnvAgencyMids @DefraGovUK @Wychavon https://t.co/Yn7mtqg0SK

We‚Äôre working with @WTBBC and @BhamCityCouncil on improvements to R.Cole in #Birmingham. Just completed an area through #BordesleyGreen  creating a meander, marginal shelves & in-channel habitat in a straightened section of river. Volunteers to plant shelves with native species https://t.co/MCPO1nVy9O
@markrwilliamson @Cambswater @camcitco @EnvAgency And why I wonder are @camcitco @wildlifebcn and @WildTroutTrust going along with this charade?

Our #Catterick Flood Storage Reservoir is operating. This reservoir #slows the #flow of water in Brough Beck as it flows towards #Catterick and the #A1 in #NorthYorkshire.
#floodriskmanagement #slowtheflow #TeamEA @EnvAgencyYNE @GavinTabinerEA @johncurtinEA @OliverHarmarEA https://t.co/TLjZvZIbj2

At the outset, @EnvAgency @HantsIWWildlife & @WinchesterCity @hantsconnect agreed that it was vital that the Durngate Flood Alleviation Scheme was communicated as 'Flood RESILIENCE' not 'Flood defence'. 
@WinchesterCity please honour this in your comms. #winnallmoors is at stake. https://t.co/CFLgSl0XaC

urls.title: The government is looking the other way while Britain's rivers die before our eyes | George Monbiot
urls.description: Across the UK, once thriving waterways are being wiped out by farming and water companies, says Guardian columnist George Monbiot

tweets.text:
"The River Wye is dying at astonishing, heartbreaking speed."
Our rivers are our lifelines, the landscape's arteries. They're thickening, drying out & dying, due to pollution, incompetence & corruption.
@EnvAgency, @DefraGovUK: how can you let this happen?
https://t.co/312hITGd6t
And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/bNAXQbWW1G

tweets.text:
John Curtin, our executive director of flood and coastal risk management, has won the @britishhydrosoc President's Prize.

The award acknowledges the ground-breaking nature of the #FCERMSrategy and John's inspirational leadership.

Congrats @JohnCurtinEA! https://t.co/ho35E5zNww
Hearing that @EnvAgencyNW #CrostonDam operated which will have probably prevented #flood in #Croston Graphs below at dam; in village & old pic of the dam working (not mine). https://t.co/XsdmFZzPx9

@360wastesupport @RachSalv @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA Was thinking more a specialist flooding (coastal and rivers) body. Leaving EA to do the enforcement for environmental crimes. More enforcement less fluffy hand holding.

urls.title: Home - GB non-native species secretariat
urls.description: First published in 2008 and updated in 2015 the GB Invasive Non-native Species Strategy was developed to meet the challenge posed by invasive non-native species in Great Britain. This website provides tools and information for those working to support the strategy.

tweets.text:
It's #PlantHealthWeek! @EnvAgency is working towards eradicating Water Primrose which is invading ponds, lakes, wetlands & waterways. This @InvasiveSp was introduced to the UK as an ornamental aquatic plant & is now banned from sale. For more: https://t.co/5crRIhAQUW
#BePlantWise https://t.co/EcD3WeS2uf
